meanings.sent1: She estimated the amount of sugar in the recipe semiquantitatively.
meanings.sent2: He measured the ingredients semiquantitatively to get a rough idea of the proportions.
meanings.sent3: The scientist jokingly attempted to calculate the results semiquantitatively using a magic eight ball.
meanings.sent4: Her understanding of the topic was only semiquantitatively accurate, like trying to measure the ocean with a teaspoon.
meanings.sent5: The concept of time was explained semiquantitatively, comparing it to grains of sand slipping through an hourglass.

meanings.definition: Using approximate quantities rather than exact measurements.
meanings.sent1: The semiquantitative approach allowed for a quick estimation of the total cost.
meanings.sent2: They used a semiquantitative method to analyze the data without needing precise values.
meanings.sent3: The artist's painting was a semiquantitative representation of the city skyline, capturing the essence without details.
meanings.sent4: His explanation was semiquantitative, painting a broad picture without delving into specifics.
meanings.sent5: The semiquantitative measurement gave a general idea of the size, but not an exact measurement.
